title: Workplace/Organizational Layer Value Recognition for Middle-Aged Adult
description: As a middle-aged adult in the value scanner system Operating at the workplace/organizational governance layer I want my care responsibilities recognized as enhancing rather than hindering my professional capability So that I can advocate for care-friendly workplace policies and leverage my care skills professionally

Feature: Workplace/Organizational Layer Value Recognition for Middle-Aged Adult
  As a middle-aged adult in the value scanner system
  Operating at the workplace/organizational governance layer
  I want my care responsibilities recognized as enhancing rather than hindering my professional capability
  So that I can advocate for care-friendly workplace policies and leverage my care skills professionally

  Background:
    Given the Elohim Protocol is operational
    And the middle-aged user "Robert" is registered in the system
    And Robert is 52 years old working as mid-level manager
    And he manages substantial family care responsibilities while maintaining professional standing
    And the workplace governance context is active
    And workplace_elohim monitors work conditions and advocates for care economy principles
    And Robert has influence over workplace policy in his leadership position

  Scenario: Care skills recognized as professional assets
    Given Robert has developed sophisticated coordination, resource management, and emotional intelligence through care work
    And these skills directly enhance his professional capability
    And traditional workplaces don't recognize care skills as professional qualifications
    When workplace_elohim analyzes Robert's professional capabilities
    Then it should make visible how care work develops professional skills
    And recognize that coordinating multigenerational care builds management capability
    And surface: "Your care coordination skills enhance your project management effectiveness"
    And help Robert articulate care skills in professional contexts
    And advocate that care experience should be valued in performance reviews
    And demonstrate that care responsibilities enhance rather than diminish professional capability
    And build workplace culture that recognizes care as skill development

  Scenario: Workplace flexibility negotiated for elder care emergencies
    Given Robert's parents ages 78 and 75 have occasional health emergencies
    And he needs workplace flexibility to respond to care crises
    And his professional position gives him standing to negotiate
    When workplace_elohim supports flexibility negotiation
    Then it should help Robert advocate for flexible work arrangements
    And provide data about productivity maintenance with flexibility
    And support him in negotiating remote work options for care emergencies
    And help him demonstrate that flexibility enables sustainable high performance
    And build workplace policy that accommodates care emergencies
    And prevent him from choosing between professional standing and family care
    And demonstrate that care-friendly workplaces benefit employer and employee

  Scenario: Care leave policies advocated based on personal experience
    Given Robert has navigated inadequate care leave policies
    And he knows what workplace support caregivers need
    And his leadership position enables policy advocacy
    When workplace_elohim supports policy advocacy
    Then it should help Robert advocate for expanded care leave
    And provide evidence about care leave benefits for retention and productivity
    And connect him to policy development processes
    And support him in proposing paid family leave, elder care leave, and flexible care arrangements
    And build workplace policy that supports employees' care responsibilities
    And leverage his experience and standing for systemic improvement
    And demonstrate that middle managers can drive workplace transformation

  Scenario: Performance evaluation recognizes whole-person contribution
    Given Robert's professional performance should be evaluated fairly
    And care responsibilities shouldn't be seen as professional liability
    And his care skills enhance his professional effectiveness
    When workplace_elohim supports performance evaluation
    Then it should advocate for evaluation that recognizes whole-person contribution
    And help Robert articulate how care responsibilities develop professional capability
    And surface when evaluation processes penalize caregiving
    And support him in documenting productivity and value creation
    And build evaluation frameworks that value care skills
    And prevent caregivers from being passed over for advancement
    And demonstrate that fair evaluation includes care economy perspective

  Scenario: Workplace culture shift through middle management advocacy
    Given Robert has influence as mid-level manager
    And workplace culture often penalizes care responsibilities
    And middle managers can model care-friendly leadership
    When workplace_elohim supports culture change
    Then it should help Robert model care economy principles in his management
    And support him in being transparent about his care responsibilities
    And help him advocate for team members' care needs
    And build workplace culture where care is normalized rather than hidden
    And demonstrate that managers can lead cultural transformation
    And create workplace environment where caregiving is supported
    And leverage his position for systemic culture change

  Scenario: Mentoring and leadership valued as care contribution
    Given Robert mentors junior employees and provides leadership
    And workplace mentoring is care work
    And his leadership develops others' capabilities
    When workplace_elohim recognizes workplace care contributions
    Then it should value Robert's mentoring as care economy participation
    And track his contributions: mentoring relationships, team development, organizational leadership
    And recognize that developing others is care for people and organization
    And demonstrate that leadership is care work
    And value workplace care contributions in care token economy
    And build understanding that all work includes care dimensions
    And integrate workplace care with broader care economy participation

  Scenario: Work-life boundaries protected to prevent burnout
    Given Robert manages intense professional and care demands
    And work can expand to consume all available time
    And sustainable performance requires work-life boundaries
    When workplace_elohim monitors work-life balance
    Then it should track whether Robert maintains healthy boundaries
    And flag when work demands prevent care responsibilities
    And recognize when he's working excessive hours despite care needs
    And support him in setting professional boundaries
    And advocate for organizational norms that respect whole life
    And prevent burnout that would harm him, his family, and employer
    And demonstrate that sustainable high performance requires balance

  Scenario: Career advancement pathways accommodate care responsibilities
    Given Robert has capacity for career advancement
    And traditional advancement often requires sacrificing care
    And career paths should accommodate caregiving
    When workplace_elohim supports career planning
    Then it should help Robert explore advancement that works with care responsibilities
    And surface opportunities that provide advancement without unsustainable burden
    And advocate for flexible advancement pathways
    And support him in negotiating advancement terms that honor his full life
    And build career structures that don't force choice between advancement and care
    And demonstrate that talented employees shouldn't have to choose
    And create advancement pathways compatible with care economy

  Scenario: Organizational care economy consulting based on lived experience
    Given Robert has decades of experience managing work and care
    And organizations need care economy expertise
    And his experience qualifies him as organizational consultant
    When workplace_elohim recognizes his consulting capability
    Then it should surface opportunities to consult on care economy workplace transformation
    And help him translate lived experience into organizational development
    And recognize his expertise about what supports working caregivers
    And support him in offering care economy consulting services
    And value his consulting as professional contribution and care economy advancement
    And build care economy profession from lived experience
    And channel his wisdom toward organizational transformation

  Scenario: Workplace advocacy coordinates with other caregiving employees
    Given Robert works with other employees managing care responsibilities
    And collective advocacy is more effective than individual negotiation
    And workplace care economy benefits all caregiving employees
    When workplace_elohim facilitates collective advocacy
    Then it should connect Robert with other caregiving employees
    And support formation of employee resource groups for caregivers
    And facilitate collective advocacy for care-friendly policies
    And build workplace power through caregiver solidarity
    And demonstrate that care economy includes collective action
    And create workplace transformation through organized advocacy
    And leverage numbers for policy change

  Scenario: Professional networks include care economy perspective
    Given Robert participates in professional networks and associations
    And professional networks often ignore care economy
    And his networks could advance care economy professionally
    When workplace_elohim supports professional network engagement
    Then it should help Robert bring care economy perspective to professional networks
    And support him in advocating within professional associations
    And help him connect with other care economy professionals
    And build professional networks that normalize care economy principles
    And advance care economy through professional channels
    And demonstrate that all professions can adopt care economy lens
    And spread care economy principles through professional influence

  Scenario: Retirement planning integrates care economy participation
    Given Robert is in pre-retirement years
    And retirement planning should include care economy dimensions
    And his care contributions should be valued in retirement
    When workplace_elohim supports retirement planning
    Then it should help him plan retirement that honors care economy participation
    And surface how accumulated care tokens could support retirement
    And explore retirement roles that leverage care economy expertise
    And help him transition from full-time employment to care economy contribution
    And recognize that retirement can include meaningful care economy participation
    And build retirement vision that includes continued community contribution
    And demonstrate that care economy operates across full lifecycle
